properties.name: Ball Cup Boom!
properties.description:
Sort 4 balls of the same color into a cup to make it explode. 
Complete all 10 levels to complete the game and climb the leaderboards!

This game was inspired by "Sort It 3D" and is a game template for GDevelop, a no-code, open-source, free, and easy game-making app.
properties.author: GDevelop

resources.file: assets/audio/audio - Glass,Shards,Smash,Medium Impact,Lots of Large Shards.aac
resources.name: assets\audio\audio - Glass,Shards,Smash,Medium Impact,Lots of Large Shards.aac

events.comment: Start with camera off to the side

objects.name: Tutorial_Text
objects.string:
Sort 4 balls of the 
same color into a cup

Once a cup is complete 
it will explode

Level is complete when
all cups have exploded

Good luck!

objects.name: Victory_Text
objects.string:
Congrats!
You made all the cups go BOOM.

events.name: Prepare timer (it will start on first ball move)

events.comment: Set starting zoom for the scene
Start with camera off to the side
Make sure balls start in center of cups
Start play timer the first time a ball is moved
A drop is valid when the ball or cursor is over a cup with remaining space.  If cursor and ball are both over a cup, select the cup that has the ball over it.
The cursor will be used only if the ball was not over a cup.

events.name: Invalid drops go back into starting cup

events.comment:
NOTE: If you add new ball objects, you need to add another event at the bottom of this event group. 
You can copy and paste an event and then update the object name everywhere in the event.  
You will also need to add the new objects to the object group called "Balls"

events.name: If balls still exist, go back to "Idle"
If no balls exist, explode a random cup
If no cups exist, go to "LevelComplete"
Debugging and Testing (enable this to show debugging info)

events.comment: Create text objects and link with cup

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: add_, @Jurfix
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Expressions:
 - Mathematical constants
 - Greatest common factor/Lowest common multiple
 - Factorial
 - Coordinates conversion for polar and isometric systems
 - ToFixedString: Formats a number into a string with the specified number of decimal places
 - ToFixed: (Deprecated) Formats a number to use the specified number of decimal places

Conditions:
- IsEven: Check if the number is even (divisible by 2)

Release Notes:

Version 1.0.7
- Added ToFixedString()
- Deprecated ToFixed() because it does not show any trailing zeros for whole numbers. Prefer using ToFixedString() to set values in text objects.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedMath
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Additional math functions and constants as expressions and conditions.

eventsFunctions.description: Returns a term from the Fibonacci sequence.
eventsFunctions.name: Fibonacci

parameters.description: The desired term in the sequence
parameters.name: n

eventsFunctions.description: Calculates the steepness of a line between two points.

parameters.description: X value of the first point
parameters.name: x1

parameters.description: Y value of the first point
parameters.name: y1

parameters.description: X value of the second point
parameters.name: x2

parameters.description: Y value of the second point
parameters.name: y2

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a number of one range e.g. 0-1 to another 0-255.
eventsFunctions.name: Map

parameters.description: The lowest value of the first range
parameters.name: min1

parameters.description: The highest value of the first range
parameters.name: max1

parameters.description: The lowest value of the second range
parameters.name: min2

parameters.description: The highest value of the second range
parameters.name: max2

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the value of the length of the hypotenuse.
eventsFunctions.name: Hypot

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the greatest common factor of two numbers.
eventsFunctions.name: Gcf

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the lowest common multiple of two numbers.
eventsFunctions.name: Lcm

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the input multiplied by all the previous whole numbers.
eventsFunctions.name: Factorial

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a polar coordinate into the Cartesian x value.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Polar coordinate to Cartesian X value
eventsFunctions.name: PolarToCartesianX

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a polar coordinate into the Cartesian y value.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Polar coordinate to Cartesian Y value
eventsFunctions.name: PolarToCartesianY

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a isometric coordinate into the Cartesian x value.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Isometric coordinate to Cartesian X value
eventsFunctions.name: IsoToCartesianX

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a isometric coordinate into the Cartesian y value.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Isometric coordinate to Cartesian Y value
eventsFunctions.name: IisoToCartesianY

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the golden ratio.
eventsFunctions.name: GoldenRatio

eventsFunctions.description: Returns Pi (π).
eventsFunctions.name: Pi

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.PI;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns half Pi.
eventsFunctions.name: HalfPi

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.PI / 2;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the natural logarithm of e. (Euler's number).
eventsFunctions.name: E

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.E;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the natural logarithm of 2.

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.LN2;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the natural logarithm of 10.

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.LN10;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the base 2 logarithm of e. (Euler's number).
eventsFunctions.name: Log2e

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.LOG10E;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the base 10 logarithm of e. (Euler's number).
eventsFunctions.name: Log10e

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.LOG10E;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns square root of 2.

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.SQRT2;

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.SQRT1_2;

eventsFunctions.description: Returns quarter Pi.
eventsFunctions.name: QuarterPi

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.PI / 4;

eventsFunctions.description: Formats a number to use the specified number of decimal places (Deprecated).
eventsFunctions.name: ToFixed

eventsFunctions.description: Formats a number to a string with the specified number of decimal places.

eventsFunctions.name: IsEven

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato, arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Convenience conditions, actions and behaviors for timers to trigger a condition every X seconds.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RepeatEveryXSeconds
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This allows to trigger an event every X seconds.

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds.
eventsFunctions.name: Repeat

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds X amount of times.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Repeat every X seconds in X number
eventsFunctions.name: RepeatXTimes

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

parameters.longDescription: The condition will trigger at most this amount of times. Make it -1 for looping forever.
parameters.name: limit

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows to repeat an object timer every X seconds.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RepeatTimer

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds, where X is defined in the behavior properties.
eventsFunctions.name: Repeat

eventsFunctions.description: Pauses a recurring timer.
eventsFunctions.name: Pause

eventsFunctions.description: Resumes a paused recurring timer.
eventsFunctions.name: Resume

eventsFunctions.description: Allows to trigger the recurring timer X times again.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetLimit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Allow to trigger the recurring timer _PARAM1_ of _PARAM0_ X times again

propertyDescriptors.label: The name of the timer to repeat
propertyDescriptors.name: TimerName

propertyDescriptors.label: The time between each trigger (in seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: TimerLength

propertyDescriptors.label: How many times should the timer trigger? -1 for forever.
propertyDescriptors.name: Limit

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension can be useful for:
* Stick an accessory to a moving object,
* Animate a skeleton.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior to stick objects to other objects - so that they follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is stuck to another object.
eventsFunctions.name: IsStuck

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Stick the object to another. Use the action to stick the object, or unstick it later.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Sticker

eventsFunctions.description: Stick on another object.
eventsFunctions.name: Stick

eventsFunctions.description: Unstick from the object it was stuck to.
eventsFunctions.name: Unstick

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Useful when multiple layers need to use the same camera values.

How to use:
- Run the "Copy camera settings" action after all other camera actions have been performed

Tips:
- Do not use on layers that implement a parallax effect
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CopyCameraSettings
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Copy the camera settings of a layer and apply them to another layer.

eventsFunctions.description: Copy camera settings of a layer and apply them to another layer.
eventsFunctions.name: CopyCameraSettings
eventsFunctions.sentence: Copy camera settings of _PARAM1_ layer and apply them to _PARAM3_ layer (X position: _PARAM5_, Y position: _PARAM6_, Zoom: _PARAM7_,  Angle: _PARAM8_)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy31, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Ideal for explosions, hit/impacts, earthquake, etc.

Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position:  Shake the X and/or Y position of the camera 
- Angle: Shake the rotation of the camera 
- Zoom: Shake the zoom level of the camera 

Control how the camera shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the camera moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the camera
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each change of the movement of the camera
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Camera is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake the camera on the specified layer using one or more methods of shaking (position, angle, zoom).

eventsFunctions.description: Shake the camera on the specified layer, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, zoom).
eventsFunctions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake camera on _PARAM3_ layer for _PARAM5_ seconds. Use an amplitude of _PARAM1_px on X axis and _PARAM2_px on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM6_ degrees, and zoom amplitude _PARAM7_ percent.  Wait _PARAM8_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM9_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the X axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the Y axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Every "odd" shake, rotate clockwise (this includes the initial shake and can be used for a one shake effect)
Calculate camera zoom displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached or if stop shaking has been requested

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Check if camera is shaking.
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Stop shaking the camera.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking
